verses.verse: You shall not see <WH7200> your brother <WH251>'s ox <WH7794> or his sheep <WH7716> go astray, <WH5080> and hide <WH5956> yourself from them: <WH7725> you shall surely bring them again <WH7725> to your brother. <WH251>

If your brother <WH251> isn't <WH7138> near to you, <WH3045> or if you don't know him, <WH622> then you shall bring it home to <WH8432> your house, <WH1004> and it shall be with you until your brother <WH251> seek <WH1875> after it, <WH7725> and you shall restore it to him.

So <WH3651> you shall do <WH6213> with his donkey; <WH2543> and so you shall do <WH6213> with his garment; <WH8071> and so you shall do <WH6213> with every lost thing <WH9> of your brother <WH251>'s, which he has lost, <WH6> and you have found: <WH4672> you may <WH3201> not hide yourself. <WH5956>

You shall not see <WH7200> your brother <WH251>'s donkey <WH2543> or his ox <WH7794> fallen down <WH5307> by the way, <WH1870> and hide <WH5956> yourself from them: <WH6965> you shall surely help him to lift them up again. <WH6965>

A woman <WH802> shall not wear men <WH1397>'s clothing, <WH3627> neither shall a man <WH1397> put <WH3847> on women <WH802>'s clothing; <WH8071> for whoever does <WH6213> these things <WH428> is an abomination <WH8441> to Yahweh <WH3068> your God. <WH430>

If a bird <WH6833>'s nest <WH7064> chance <WH7122> to be before <WH6440> you in the way, <WH1870> in any tree <WH6086> or on the ground, <WH776> with young ones <WH667> or eggs, <WH1000> and the hen <WH517> sitting <WH7257> on the young, <WH667> or on the eggs, <WH1000> you shall not take <WH3947> the hen <WH517> with the young: <WH1121>

you shall surely <WH7971> let the hen <WH517> go, <WH7971> but the young <WH1121> you may take <WH3947> to yourself; <WH3190> that it may be well with you, <WH748> and that you may prolong your days. <WH3117>

When you build <WH1129> a new <WH2319> house, <WH1004> then you shall make <WH6213> a battlement <WH4624> for your roof, <WH1406> that you don't <WH7760> bring blood <WH1818> on your house, <WH1004> if any man <WH5307> fall from there. <WH5307>

You shall not sow <WH2232> your vineyard <WH3754> with two kinds of seed, <WH2233> lest the whole fruit <WH4395> be forfeited, <WH6942> the seed <WH2233> which you have sown, <WH2232> and the increase <WH8393> of the vineyard. <WH3754>
You shall not plow <WH2790> with an ox <WH7794> and a donkey <WH2543> together. <WH3162>
You shall not wear <WH3847> a mixed <WH8162> stuff, <WH6785> wool and linen <WH6593> together. <WH3162>
You shall make <WH6213> yourselves fringes <WH1434> on the four <WH702> borders <WH3671> of your cloak, <WH3682> with which you cover yourself. <WH3680>
If any man <WH376> takes <WH3947> a wife, <WH802> and goes in <WH935> to her, <WH8130> and hates her,

and accuses <WH7760> her of shameful <WH5949> things, <WH1697> and brings up <WH3318> an evil <WH7451> name <WH8034> on her, <WH559> and says, "I took <WH3947> this woman, <WH802> and when I came <WH7126> near to her, <WH4672> I didn't find in her the tokens of virginity; <WH1331>"

then shall the father <WH1> of the young lady, <WH5291> and her mother, <WH517> take <WH3947> and bring forth <WH3318> the tokens of the young lady <WH5291>'s virginity <WH1331> to the elders <WH2205> of the city <WH5892> in the gate; <WH8179>
and the young lady <WH5291>'s father <WH1> shall tell <WH559> the elders, <WH2205> "I gave <WH5414> my daughter <WH1323> to this man <WH376> to wife, <WH802> and he hates her; <WH8130>

and behold, <WH7760> he has accused her of shameful <WH5949> things, <WH1697> saying, <WH559> <WH4672> 'I didn't find in your daughter <WH1323> the tokens of virginity; <WH1331>' and yet these are the tokens of my daughter <WH1323>'s virginity. <WH1331>" They shall spread <WH6566> the cloth <WH8071> before <WH6440> the elders <WH2205> of the city. <WH5892>
The elders <WH2205> of that city <WH5892> shall take <WH3947> the man <WH376> and chastise him; <WH3256>

and they shall fine <WH6064> him one hundred <WH3967> shekels of silver, <WH3701> and give <WH5414> them to the father <WH1> of the young lady, <WH5291> because he has brought up <WH3318> an evil <WH7451> name <WH8034> on a virgin <WH1330> of Israel: <WH3478> and she shall be his wife; <WH802> he may <WH3201> not put her away <WH7971> all his days. <WH3117>
But if this thing <WH1697> be true, <WH571> that the tokens of virginity <WH1331> were not found <WH4672> in the young lady; <WH5291>

then they shall bring out <WH3318> the young lady <WH5291> to the door <WH6607> of her father <WH1>'s house, <WH1004> and the men <WH582> of her city <WH5892> shall stone <WH5619> her to death <WH4191> with stones, <WH5619> because she has done <WH6213> folly <WH5039> in Israel, <WH3478> to play the prostitute <WH2181> in her father <WH1>'s house: <WH1004> so you shall put <WH1197> away <WH1197> the evil <WH7451> from the midst of you. <WH7130>

If a man <WH376> be found <WH4672> lying <WH7901> with a woman <WH802> married <WH1166> to a husband, <WH1167> then they shall both of them <WH8147> die, <WH4191> the man <WH376> who lay <WH7901> with the woman, <WH802> and the woman: <WH802> so you shall put away <WH1197> the evil <WH7451> from Israel. <WH3478>
If there is a young lady <WH5291> who is a virgin <WH1330> pledged to be married <WH781> to a husband, <WH376> and a man <WH376> find <WH4672> her in the city, <WH5892> and lie with her; <WH7901>

then you shall bring <WH3318> them both <WH8147> out to the gate <WH8179> of that city, <WH5892> and you shall stone <WH5619> them to death <WH4191> with stones; <WH68> the lady, <WH5291> because <WH834> she didn't <WH6817> cry, being in the city; <WH5892> and the man, <WH376> because <WH834> he has humbled <WH6031> his neighbor <WH7453>'s wife: <WH802> so you shall put away <WH1197> the evil <WH7451> from the midst of you. <WH7130>

But if the man <WH376> find <WH4672> the lady <WH5291> who is pledged to be married <WH781> in the field, <WH7704> and the man <WH376> force <WH2388> her, <WH7901> and lie with her; <WH376> then the man only who lay <WH7901> with her shall die: <WH4191>

but to the lady <WH5291> you shall do <WH6213> nothing; <WH1697> there is in the lady <WH5291> no sin <WH2399> worthy of death: <WH4194> for as when a man <WH376> rises <WH6965> against his neighbor, <WH7453> and kills <WH7523> him, <WH1697> even so is this matter;
for he found <WH4672> her in the field, <WH7704> the pledged to be married <WH781> lady <WH5291> cried, <WH6817> and there was none to save her. <WH3467>
If a man <WH376> find <WH4672> a lady <WH5291> who is a virgin, <WH1330> who is not pledged to be married, <WH781> and lay hold <WH8610> on her, <WH7901> and lie with her, <WH4672> and they be found;

then the man <WH376> who lay <WH7901> with her shall give <WH5414> to the lady <WH5291>'s father <WH1> fifty <WH2572> shekels of silver, <WH3701> and she shall be his wife, <WH802> because he has humbled <WH6031> her; <WH3201> he may not put her away <WH7971> all his days. <WH3117>
A man <WH376> shall not take <WH3947> his father <WH1>'s wife, <WH802> and shall not uncover <WH1540> his father <WH1>'s skirt. <WH3671>
